Ad Text:
About us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation. As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world's most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.


About the role:

Shape the Future of Australia’s Naval Combat Capability

We’re seeking an experienced Capability Sustainment & Development Engineer – AEGIS Combat System to help define the long-term growth, evolution, and sustainment strategy of one of Australia’s most advanced naval combat systems.

This role offers an opportunity to influence capability planning, system sustainment, and future upgrades across the Royal Australian Navy’s AEGIS-equipped fleet.

You’ll combine your systems engineering expertise with a strategic outlook to develop a 5–10-year capability roadmap, ensuring continuous enhancement, risk-based decision-making, and through-life system support. 

In this customer-facing and highly collaborative position, you will:

Lead the continuous development and evolution of the AEGIS Combat System, steering enhancement, upgrade, and sustainment planning to deliver a capability roadmap.

Conduct technical and risk-based assessments to support long-term planning and prioritisation.

Collaborate with the Destroyer Enterprise and Defence stakeholders to align capability development with operational needs.

Lead capability planning workshops, stakeholder reviews, and customer discussions on sustainment and future capability direction.

Contribute to system architecture, obsolescence management, engineering change proposals (ECPs), and lifecycle support planning.

Provide engineering guidance across the systems lifecycle and ensure alignment with the overall Combat System strategy. 

 
About you:

You’re a seasoned Systems Engineer or Capability Planner with a deep understanding of complex defence systems and a passion for shaping long-term capability outcomes.

You’ll bring:

Substantial experience across the systems engineering lifecycle, particularly in capability enhancement and sustainment planning.

Proven ability to develop or contribute to capability roadmaps or long-term technical strategies.

Knowledge of system architecture, lifecycle management, obsolescence management, and change control processes.

Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with experience representing engineering perspectives to Defence customers.

Prior experience in a Defence acquisition or sustainment environment—ideal for former ADF personnel or engineers with headquarter-level planning exposure.

A degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Mechatronics, Aerospace, or related engineering.

An Australian NV-1 security clearance and ability to access/handle Export Controlled technology, data and information.




Why join us: 

At Lockheed Martin, you’ll have the opportunity to influence the future direction of Australia’s naval combat capability and work alongside some of the most skilled engineers and Defence professionals in the industry.

You’ll be empowered to take a strategic, long-term view, balancing innovation, sustainment, and mission readiness across the system’s lifecycle.


How we reward and support you: 

When you join Lockheed Martin, you work on projects you won’t experience anywhere else.

We offer you a range of benefits built to suit you, no matter what stage of life you are in. 

Flexible work & Hybrid work options

Access to our online discounts program offering immediate discounts or cashback

A variety of leave options including Purchase Leave to support you and your family  

Additional benefits such as Annual Flu Vaccinations, Novated Leasing and Fitness Programs


Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance and employment may be contingent on the provision of further personal information including citizenship to ensure compliance with international export control legislation and regulations.

A Veteran-friendly Workplace:

Veterans are encouraged to apply. We highly value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and transitioning service members can contribute to our team. We are proud to be recognised as a Veteran Friendly Employer by the Australian Government.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Lockheed Martin Australia supports Equal Employment Opportunity and values diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, free of unlawful discrimination and is harassment free, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. By leveraging our employees' unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

As part of our endeavours to increase participation of Indigenous Australians, we welcome applications from all people, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone can thrive. If you are selected for this role, we would be happy to discuss any accommodations that will help you to be successful.

About Us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation.  As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world’s most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.


About the Role:

We currently have a position of Configuration and Data Management Analyst based out of Mawson Lakes, SA. The primary responsibilities will focus on Data Management tasks including, managing the Programs technical data, CDRL deliveries to/from the customer, document editing/publishing, and managing SDRL deliveries to/from subcontractors. 

Some of your responsibilities will include:

Apply the processes and procedures for the identification, control and distribution of project data

Coordinate reviews of documentation to ensure customer contract and company requirements are met

Document registration, control and distribution

Share information between the LMA and external parties, ensuring data sensitivities are maintained

Gather, maintain, format, compile, and manipulate technical data to support engineering reporting

Supporting end users in the most optimal use of LMA’s Electronic Document Management (Windchill) system

Progress change objects through the review and Configuration Management process

Support the continuous improvement activities as they relate to CDM

Provide support to Configuration Manager as required 

 

About You: 

This position is situated within the Engineering Information Team.

Although a background in Defence and/or Engineering is desirable, it is not essential. The successful candidate must demonstrate that they have a background in Document/Records Management, are a proficient user of Windows based computer systems, and have fast and accurate data entry skills.

Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively with customers and internal stakeholders are essential. You must also be eligible to obtain an Australian Defence NV1 Security Clearance.

 

How we reward and support you?

When you join Lockheed Martin, you work on projects you won’t experience anywhere else.

We offer you a range of benefits built to suit you, no matter what stage of life you are in. 

Flexible work & Hybrid work options

Access to our online discounts program offering immediate discounts or cashback

A variety of leave options including Purchase Leave to support you and your family  

Additional benefits such as Annual Flu Vaccinations, Novated Leasing and Fitness Programs


Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance (NV1) and employment may be contingent on the provision of further personal information including citizenship to ensure compliance with international export control legislation and regulations. 

A Veteran-friendly Workplace:

Veterans are encouraged to apply. We highly value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and transitioning service members can contribute to our team. 

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Lockheed Martin Australia supports Equal Employment Opportunity and values diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, free of unlawful discrimination and is harassment free, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. By leveraging our employees’ unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

As part of our endeavours to increase participation of Indigenous Australians, we welcome applications from all people, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone can thrive. If you are selected for this role, we would be happy to discuss any accommodations that will help you to be successful.

Seeking a hands-on Head of AI Engineering



Your new company
Hays has partnered with a long-standing public-sector organisation delivering large-scale, mission-led digital programs. Join a technology-forward organisation focused on responsibly introducing modern tools while operating under strict governance and privacy obligations.


Your new role
A long term contract leading the technical build and operational rollout of AI projects across the organisation. A practical AI engineering lead who contributes code, diagnoses production issues and drives end-to-end implementation across data and model workflows. Create and champion reusable architectural patterns and components that speed secure, repeatable AI rollouts in mixed legacy and cloud environments. Advise on applied GenAI approaches, retrieval-augmented pipelines, vector search, embeddings and copilot-style integrations with a focus on feasibility and risk. Convert technical trade-offs into concise guidance for senior stakeholders and take responsibility for architectural choices through to delivery. Partner with product owners, compliance, ICT and business groups to ensure solutions are responsible, usable and deliver clear operational benefit. Steer initiatives through governance checkpoints so work progresses from prototype to production while meeting lifecycle, security and regulatory needs. Work with business teams to phase delivery into pragmatic, high-value increments that mitigate risk and unlock longer-term change.


What you'll need to succeed
At least ten years' experience in software or data engineering, including five or more years delivering AI/ML outcomes in enterprise settings. A proven ability to produce results within legacy-constrained and resource-limited environments while remaining pragmatic about scope. Strong hands-on capability in Python and contemporary agentic AI frameworks, paired with experience in cloud-native designs (Azure desirable). Practical expertise across data platforms such as data lakes, APIs and integration approaches, plus productionising models with monitoring, security and retraining workflows. A solid understanding of Responsible AI principles, privacy-by-design and compliance considerations relevant to public-sector contexts. Experience mentoring engineers and lifting capability by embedding DevOps/MLOps practices, automated testing and operational monitoring. Excellent communication and stakeholder skills with a history of building cross-functional ways of working.


What you'll get in return
A senior technical contract where you directly shape how AI is adopted across a large public program.
The opportunity to design and deliver ethical, operational AI solutions that produce measurable benefits for users.
A hybrid work arrangement combining remote flexibility with regular in-person collaboration.
A chance to lead capability uplift, mentor technical teams and institutionalise modern engineering practices.
Meaningful exposure to complex, high-impact problems that enhance your leadership record in regulated environments.





If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Head of AI Engineering

Location: Eveleigh NSW
Duration: 12 months
Start Date: 3 November 2025
Pay Rate: $1,350 per day + superannuation
Hours: 8 hours per day / 40 hours per week
Checks Required: 2 Reference Checks & Police Check

About the Role
The NSW Department of Education is seeking a hands-on, delivery-focused AI Engineering Leader to drive the practical adoption of Artificial Intelligence across one of Australia’s largest education systems.
This role suits a technologist who can both articulate the art of the possible and deliver real-world solutions in a complex, legacy-constrained environment.

Key Responsibilities
Lead the design and implementation of scalable, secure AI solutions aligned with the Department’s AI Assurance Framework.
Provide hands-on technical direction across data engineering, model integration, MLOps pipelines, and legacy system modernisation.
Guide teams on GenAI, RAG pipelines, embeddings, vector search, and copilots within real-world delivery constraints.
Collaborate with educators, compliance, ICT, and business leaders to ensure safe, responsible, and high-impact AI adoption.
Mentor engineers and analysts to build AI capability and embed best practices across DevOps/MLOps, monitoring, and responsible AI delivery.
About You
You’re a practical innovator with deep technical credibility and a proven ability to deliver AI solutions in enterprise environments. You’re comfortable writing code and leading teams through ambiguity — balancing innovation, compliance, and delivery discipline.

Skills & Experience
10+ years in software or data engineering, including 5+ years delivering AI/ML solutions.
Expertise in Python, agentic AI frameworks, Azure, and modern data platform architectures.
Experience in AIOps, responsible AI, and compliance-driven delivery.
Demonstrated success leading teams in legacy-constrained and resource-limited environments.
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills.
Desirable
Familiarity with education technology or other regulated sectors.
APPLY NOW

Company Description


Lendi Group is a market-leading digital platform business focused on transforming the home loan industry. It operates the country’s #1 retail mortgage broker – the iconic Aussie Home Loans franchise – and the Australia’s #1 digital mortgage brand, Lendi.

Together, with its national network of 1,300 brokers and 230 retail stores, the Lendi Group brands give all Australians the power of choice, and confidence, in one of life’s biggest financial decisions.

Building on this market-leading foundation, Lendi Groups vision is to be the undisputed place for Australians to buy and own property through our new Aussie Homes propositions.

Lendi Group’s loan book is more than $100b and it was named Australia’s Aggregator of the Year for 2024

Diversity, Equality, and Inclusion are fundamental to the success of Lendi Group. We’re passionate about fostering an environment where our team members feel valued and supported and we celebrate everyone’s unique identity.

To learn more about life at Lendi Group check out our blog: https://www.lendi.com.au/inspire/category/life-at-lendi/

About the role?

Lendi Group is looking for a Senior Platform Engineer to join our Platform team. A small, tight and highly collaborative team working in a rapid and evolving DevSecOps environment. We like to have fun and we work hard at looking after each other. 

The Platform team builds cross-team tooling and services that empower our Specialist and Product teams to deliver customer value efficiently and with high quality. The engineering department is going through significant growth and there are opportunities for you to help shape the culture and technology moving forward.

Please note, this is a 12 month Fixed term opportunity.

Job Description


Manage a high performing & secure cloud environment
Owning major parts of the system, designing and delivering quality stable solutions 
Developing clean, maintainable code that is suitable for continuous integration and deployment, following best practices and DevOps/Software guidelines
Collaborating as part of a cross-functional agile team
Improve our platform by learning and implementing new technologies
Build & manage different tools to facilitate the way different teams use our platform
Automate whenever possible so it is easy to deploy to multiple environments & recover
Increase the visibility of the different services
Work with different teams to understand how to better use our platform
Experiment and build with AI and integrate it into our tooling and environments.
Participate on a fun team that loves learning together & helping each other
Owning the code you and your team build, which means supporting debugging, monitoring and alerting in the production

Qualifications


3-5+ years of experience as a Platform and/or DevOps Engineer
A passion for learning every day 
A desire to work with technologies such as Kubernetes, AWS, Large Language Models (LLMs) and others
Experience working with configuration as code, CI/CD and pushing and reviewing code.

Additional Information


Lendi Group teams operate across Australia and the Philippines. We’re committed to creating a new era of seamless connection in property finance by changing the way Australians experience property lending, for good.

A few of the benefits that our people rave about include:

A vibrant, relaxed, yet professional culture
Holistic wellbeing programs offering 24/7 support, including medical, mental health, and financial wellbeing services to enable our workforce to thrive at home and work
Generous Paid Parental Leave: we celebrate our growing Lendi Group family with 18-26 weeks leave for primary carers and up to 4 weeks for secondary carers
An additional week’s Loyalty Leave each year after reaching 3 years of service
Wellness initiatives with a strong focus on psychological safety
Social groups such as our industry-leading Women in Technology group.

Our culture is guided by our 3 core values: We Are Stronger United; Act Like You Own It; and Keep Home Loans Human. Our values are part of our core DNA that helps Lendi Group to attract, engage and evolve the right talent and build best-in-class products.

Feeling like you don’t meet all the skills listed? That’s ok; we are always on the lookout for different skills, experience, and qualities and so we’d still like to hear from you.

#lendigroup #LI-GR2 #LI-hybrid

The Company

Civmec is an Australian-owned, integrated, multidisciplinary heavy engineering and construction services provider to the energy, resources, infrastructure, marine and defence sectors. Our diversification enables us to operate extensively across the nation, supporting a wide range of landmark projects and providing variety and career development opportunities for our workforce.

The Role

Civmec is seeking a talented and detail-driven Configuration Engineer to support the Configuration Management Team in delivering robust configuration control across a complex defence shipbuilding program.


This is a key technical role focused on implementing configuration processes, managing product lifecycle data, and supporting system integration. The successful candidate will ensure accurate reporting and full traceability of configuration items from design through to delivery — contributing directly to the integrity and success of one of Australia's most significant defence programs.

Duties and Responsibilities

Collaborate with the Configuration Management Lead to implement and maintain configuration management processes
Serve as the technical expert for PLM systems including data modelling, integrations, and automation.
Develop and maintain Configuration Status Accounting and Baseline Reports using scripting and analytical tools.
Administer and optimise configuration management tools such as Teamcenter, TCRA, Jira, and Power BI.
Perform advanced data analysis to support configuration audits, hange impact assessments, and baseline integrity checks.
Support Engineering Change Proposal (ECP) workflows, ensuring accurate data traceability across digital systems.
Automate reporting and dashboarding solutions to provide real-time visibility into configuration status and metrics.

About You

To be successful in the role you will possess the following:

Degree in Engineering, Information Systems, or a related technical discipline.
Strong analytical mindset with excellent attention to detail and data integrity.
Excellent communication skills for cross-functional collaboration and technical documentation.
Good understanding of IT system landscapes, including server environments, scheduled tasks, and basic troubleshooting.
Hands-on experience with PLM systems, especially Siemens Teamcenter.
Proficiency in SQL and Python for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Due to the Security Clearance required for this position, applicants must be an Australian Citizen and eligible to obtain and uphold a Baseline Security Clearance through the Australian Department of Defence.

Civmec + You

At Civmec, we offer an inclusive workplace built on family values, with a ‘Never Assume' culture, sustained by our experienced and supportive management team. We believe our workforce is our greatest asset, and that's why we provide an environment rich in career development opportunities to upskill and develop professionally. Our generous Reward and Recognition scheme recognises employees that go the extra mile. Our staff benefits scheme gives you access to accident and sickness insurance, and a range of travel, entertainment, vehicle and lifestyle discounts.

How to Apply

Please click the "apply" link to start your application. We look forward to starting the pathway to your career with Civmec.

Alternatively, please email recruitment@civmec.com.au for a confidential chat or call our Recruitment Team on (08) 6595 5888.

Civmec is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders. Defence force experience is desirable, and veterans are encouraged to apply. We respectfully request no agency submissions.
Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram for news, updates and career opportunities!

DyFlex is an established SAP Platinum Partner with offices across Australia. We are recognised as a leader in our area of SAP expertise. We deliver fit-for-purpose SAP solutions, and our services range from greenfield and brownfield implementations, change management to ongoing Aftercare services and support.

In 2025, we have been awarded

✓ Best Performing Partner in Australia for S/4 HANA Public Cloud

✓ Best Performing Partner in Australia for Speed of Delivery

✓ Best Performing Partner in Mid-Market

✓ Highest Selling Partner in Australia

About the Role:
As a Consulting AI / Data Engineer, you will design, build, and optimise enterprise-scale data solutions, helping our clients unlock the value of their data and accelerate performance. This role blends hands-on technical delivery with client-facing consulting, giving you the opportunity to shape scalable solutions using Databricks, cloud platforms, and modern data engineering practices. You’ll play a key role in building DyFlex’s emerging Data and AI capability, ensuring our clients achieve meaningful business outcomes through innovative data solutions.

Your tasks and responsibilities:

Build and maintain scalable data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and delivering data
Manage and optimise databases, warehouses, and cloud storage solutions
Implement data quality frameworks and testing processes to ensure reliable systems
Design and deliver cloud-based solutions (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
Take technical ownership of project components and lead small development teams
Engage directly with clients, translating business requirements into technical solutions
Champion best practices including version control, CI/CD, and infrastructure as code

Your qualifications and experience:

Hands-on data engineering experience in production environments
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL; experience with at least one additional language (e.g. Java, Typescript/Javascript)
Experience with modern frameworks such as Apache Spark, Airflow, dbt, Kafka, or Flink
Background in building ML pipelines, MLOps practices, or feature stores is highly valued
Proven expertise in relational databases, data modelling, and query optimisation
Demonstrated ability to solve complex technical problems independently
Excellent communication skills with ability to engage clients and stakeholders
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field

What we offer:

Work with SAP’s latest technologies on cloud as S/4HANA, BTP and Joule, plus Databricks, ML/AI tools and cloud platforms
A flexible and supportive work environment including work from home
Competitive remuneration and benefits including novated lease, birthday leave, remote working, additional purchased leave, and company-provided laptop
Competitive remuneration and benefits including novated lease, birthday leave, salary packaging, wellbeing programme, additional purchased leave, and company-provided laptop Comprehensive training budget and paid certifications (Databricks, SAP, cloud platforms)
Structured career advancement pathways with mentoring from senior engineers
Exposure to diverse industries and client environments

Join a renowned organisation delivering projects to some of Australia’s leading enterprises

DyFlex is committed to providing a safe, flexible and respectful environment for staff free from all forms of discrimination, bullying and harassment. We are proud of our diverse and inclusive team as only together we can continually improve ourselves and achieve best outcomes for our customers– we are the region's leading SAP Platinum Partner!

Please note that we can’t offer sponsorship for this role and we expect a clear statement about your legal rights in Australia, especially if you are applying from overseas.

Are you passionate about data strategy, architecture, and empowering businesses with data-driven insights? Do you enjoy designing scalable solutions and guiding organizations through complex data challenges? At InterWorks, we’re looking for a Data Architect who thrives in dynamic environments and is ready to help shape the future of data for our clients.

This role blends the rigor of enterprise data architecture and governance with the energy of consulting and solution-building. You’ll work with clients across industries to build robust data platforms, define standards, and implement governance frameworks that create lasting value.

Please be advised that this role is required to be located in the Perth, Australia InterWorks office. Remote work or telecommuting arrangements outside of this jurisdiction are not permissible for this position.

Salary range commensurate with experience and qualifications.

What You’ll Do

Architect and implement enterprise-level data solutions that align with business goals and compliance requirements.

Design and optimize data models, storage solutions, and integration pipelines across various platforms (Snowflake, Databricks, etc.).

Partner directly with clients to develop scalable data platforms, data governance frameworks, and analytics strategies.

Create and oversee ETL/ELT processes and advise on best practices for data quality, security, and accessibility.

Serve as a strategic liaison between business and IT to bridge gaps and ensure alignment.

Manage project timelines, expectations, and deliverables with clear communication and strong stakeholder engagement.

What You’ll Need

Must-Haves

5+ years of experience in data architecture, data engineering, or a related field

High proficiency in SQL and strong data modeling skills

Experience in data governance, compliance standards, and enterprise data strategy

Excellent communication skills—written, verbal, and interpersonal

Ability to thrive in client-facing environments and lead cross-functional teams

Adaptability and problem-solving mindset in fast-paced and ambiguous situations

Proven experience with data lakehouse architecture including the storage and processing of semi-structured and unstructured file types

Proven support for data science initiatives

Understanding of pipeline and cost monitoring and optimisation

Comfortable leading business engagements to source requirements or refine data models

Experience with Azure & AWS CSP's preferable

What We’d Like You to Have

Experience with BI and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)

Familiarity with modern data warehouses and cloud platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks)

ETL tool experience (e.g., dbt, Matillion, Informatica, Fivetran)

Knowledge of AI/ML concepts and their role in data platforms

Degree in Computer Science, IT, or a related field (preferred)
